question: Player A declares an attack with their ${0} on a Monster Player B controls. On attack declaration, Player A activates the effect of ${0} to banish that opponent Monster. Does a replay occur?
explanation:
A replay can only occur before the Damage Step starts.

When Player A attacks, a replay can occur in the following situations:

  • ● The number of Monsters on Player B changes (even momentarily)
  • ● The attack target leaves the field
  • ● The attacking Monster gains the ability to attack directly
  • ● The attacking monster can no longer attack how it was attacking (mostly applies to a Monster that had the ability to attack directly but loses it, due to negation, etc.)

In this case, the attack target left the field on attack declaration, so a replay can occur.

propositions: The 1st effect of ${3} (assuming Player B controls no Monsters)

question: Player A controls a Special Summoned Monster, activates ${0} and sends a Monster from their Deck to the GY, while Player B has ${1} and ${2} in their hand. Which effects can Player B trigger in a new chain after resolution?
propositions: Only the 1st effect of ${1}, and the 1st effect of ${2} cannot be activated
Only the 1st effect of ${2}, and the 1st effect of ${1} cannot be activated
Only the 1st effect of ${1} OR only the 1st effect of ${2}
cards: Green Baboon, Defender of the Forest
explanation: Both ${1} and ${2} have met their activation conditions. However, you cannot activate 2 Optional Trigger effects that Special Summon themselves from hand in the same chain. Both of these effects are Optional Triggers that would have the card that activates it Special Summon itself from the hand. Therefore, only one of these effects can be activated in a chain, not both. I could not find it written in the perfect Rulebook, but it seems to have a precedent in ${3}.

question: Player A controls a face-up ${0} and Player B controls a face-up ${1}. Player A would like to activate the 2nd effect of their ${0} by tributing itself to target Player's B ${1} in a attempt to destroy it. Can they activate that effect and if so, how does it resolve?
propositions: Player A cannot activate the 2nd effect of ${0}
Player A can activate the 2nd effect of ${0}, but it will be negated by the effect of ${1}
Player A can activate the 2nd effect of ${0}, and ${1} will be destroyed
explanation:
Unless specifically prevented to do so by another effect or restriction, a Monster whose effects are negated can still activate its effects, provided activation requirements are met and costs can be paid. Costs will be paid, and the effect negated at resolution. ${1} reminds you of that in brackets, but that's not specific to ${1}, it applies to all cards that negate the effects of Monsters. So Player A can activate the effect of their ${0}.

To know how it resolves, it is important to note how ${1} is worded. It negates the effects of Monsters on the field while they are on the field. Meaning that as soon as a Monster leaves the field, its effects are no longer negated. In this case, ${0}' effect was activated and resolves on the field, but since it is no longer on the field to be negated, ${1} will be destroyed.

I would have loved to find a specific ruling entry to illustrate that, but I couldn't find one on ygorg's database.

Therefore, it cannot be negated by ${1} and ${0} will be banished.
